Legal_Issue: Whether the respondent met the residence requirements under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Context: Appeal under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Credibility_Assessment: Respondent's claims found inconsistent and lacking credibility
Basis_of_Claim: Alleged failure to meet 1095-day residency requirement
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of the citizenship judge's decision
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Insufficient evidence of physical presence in Canada
Application_Error: Failure to apply or clarify the appropriate test for residency
Assessment_Standard: One of three approaches: strict physical presence, strong attachment, or place of centralized existence
Legal_Standard: Residency requirement of at least 1095 days within four years
Application_Factor: Physical presence, attachment to Canada, centralized life
Decision_Outcome: Remanded to a new citizenship judge for reconsideration
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable conclusion due to lack of justification and evidence
Outcome_of_Review: Original decision set aside, case referred
Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 5(1)(c), subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to adequately justify decision or clarify legal test applied
Document_Fraud: Potential misrepresentation through incomplete or inaccurate documentation
Credibility_Issues: Respondent's claims not supported by reliable evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Respondent challenged Minister's appeal regarding residency
Procedural_Issue: Insufficient reasoning by the citizenship judge
Omission_Type: Failure to specify residency test used
